steps.description: 1. Locate every connected maroon (value 8) framed object in the same-size canvas and count how many distinct enclosed black/background holes (0) each object surrounds (the image contains four such objects with 1, 3, 2, and 1 holes respectively).

2. Recolor all maroon pixels of each object according to its hole count (apply the same rule to every object): if the object encloses 1 hole → change its maroon pixels to color 1; if 2 holes → change to color 3; if 3 holes → change to color 2. Do not alter any background (0) or hole cells.
3. Keep the canvas dimensions, object shapes, positions, and all non‑maroon pixels exactly as in the input; only replace maroon regions by the new color per step 2.
